title: HS30094: Economics Of Rural Development - Quick Facts
text:
HS30094
Course name | Economics Of Rural Development
Offered by | Humanities & Social Sciences
Credits | 3
L-T-P | 3-0-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | Autumn

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisites: NoneCourse ContentsEconomics and Rural Studies, Nature and Scope Rural Development; Rural Development-Approaches, Experiments, Policies and Programmes; Rural Infrastructure and Rural Development; Agricultural Transformation and Rural Development; Rural Banking and Credit; Rural Industrialization; Decentralization and Rural Development; Rural Marketing; Globalization and Rural Development-The Role of Institutions; Micro Finance and Rural Development; Womens Participation and Rural Development; Rural Poverty: Concept and Measurement; Entitlement and Deprivation; Rural-Urban Interdependence - Models of Rural-Urban Migration, Migration and Urbanization Dilemma; Urban Bias; Explaining Growth in a Rural-Urban System; Rural Development in India; Rural Policies; NGOs and Rural Development.
